result.execSummary:
The defendant Lauren M Kapellusch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 2 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.

Defendant Lauren M Kapellusch in court with attorney Brian P. Dimmer.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State moves to amend count 1 to an ordinance DC violation.
Plea - Ct.1 - NC.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.   Ct.2 - DRI.
$25+cc, 60 dtp, ftp 2 days RCJ for contempt.
Status conference on May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 16, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No violent contact with the victim, GF,  (person, property, residence or family).   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Lauren M Kapellusch in court with attorney Brian P. Dimmer.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
